result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth advised that the DE has a new case and just appeared in intake today. Trailing new case to prelim.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Dwane A. Bowling Jr. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth sates that this case has resolved.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
NO RECORD MADE.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Attorney Barth appears on behalf of the DE.   Clerk. M.Burke. Case remains set for trial but may resolve.

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Barth.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Barth verbally requests a speedy trial, court advises that he will need to file it in writing. JS set for 09/19/22 at 8:30 with a JSH of 09/12/22 at 1:15.
NO RECORD MADE.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Barth who appears by zoom.  Clerk. M.Burke. A STC set to 08/11/22 at 1:30.
Atty Michael Barth
No Attorney Assigned

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody by zoom.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE states he does not have an Attorney yet, SPD has not appointed yet. DE states he does wish to have an attorney. JS of 06/27/22 and JSH of 06/21/22 are taken off calendar  Due to the speedy trial demand JS set for 08/08/22 at 8:30 with a JSH on 07/26/22 at 1:15.

Defendant Dwane A. Bowling in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Court hold colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se today.  DE proceeds pro se.     DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to DE.  DE has filed Motion for Speedy Trial.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:36 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on 5/10/22 @ 815am before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond is continued.  DE motion to modify bond.  arguments heard.  Court denies motion.  DE want to proceed pro se and not wait for SPD.    jk

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody by zoom.   Clerk. M.Burke. Court advises DE he filed his speedy trial demand too early. He must wait until after his arraingment to requst speedy trial demand. No futher action taken.
